flagged_text: Not theory, not motivational content. Just what I observed building software, leading teams, and running side projects in a year that changed the rules.
user_issue: Sounds performative — the 'not X, not Y, just Z' structure tries too hard to establish credibility
pattern: credibility_posturing — negation list followed by 'just' to position the writer as authentic
fix_applied: Replaced with direct statement about what happened, added honest admission ('Some landed. Some didn't.')
suggested_rule: Flag 'Not X, not Y. Just [what I actually did]' patterns — they announce authenticity instead of demonstrating it
